maml:description.maml:para: Enables the AVD Diagnostics and will send it to a new LogAnalytics workspace
The function will enable AVD diagnostics for a hostpool. It will create a new Log Analytics workspace if no existing workspace is provided.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
Enter the name of the Log Analytics Workspace
Enter the name of the Log Analytics SKU
Enter the name of the Log Analyics Workspace resource group
The diagnostics name shown in the hostpool diagnostics overview
The categories you like to save in Log Analytics
How long should the data be saved
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
Enter the name of the Log Analytics Workspace
Enter the name of the Log Analytics SKU
Enter the name of the Log Analyics Workspace resource group
The diagnostics name shown in the hostpool diagnostics overview
The categories you like to save in Log Analytics
How long should the data be saved
Enable AVD Start VM on Connect
This function will enable the start VM on connect option in the hostpool and will configure the Azure AD permissions. It will create a new role (WVD Start VM on connect) in the Azure AD
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
{{ Fill HostsResourceGroup Description }}
{{ Fill RoleName Description }}
Set these parameter to force changing the ValidationEnvironment to true.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
{{ Fill HostsResourceGroup Description }}
{{ Fill RoleName Description }}
Set these parameter to force changing the ValidationEnvironment to true.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.

{{ Fill RoleName Description }}
Set these parameter to force changing the ValidationEnvironment to true.
Exports the WVD environment, based on the hostpool name.
The function will help you exporting the complete WVD environment to common output types as HTML and CSV.
Enter the WVD hostpoolname name.
Enter the WVD hostpool resource group name.
Enter the filename. Based on the format parameter the function will create a correct file. Default filepath is in the execution directory.
Enter the format you like. For creating more formats use a comma.
Enter the WVD hostpoolname name.
Enter the WVD hostpool resource group name.
{{ Fill Console Description }}
Enter the WVD hostpoolname name.
Enter the WVD hostpool resource group name.
Enter the filename. Based on the format parameter the function will create a correct file. Default filepath is in the execution directory.
Enter the format you like. For creating more formats use a comma.
{{ Fill Console Description }}
Get WVD Hostpool information, including the underlaying session hosts
With this function you can get information about a WVD hostpool that includes the information about the underlaying session hosts.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want information from.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want information from.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
Gets the image version from where the session host is started from.
The function will help you getting insights if there are session hosts started from an old version in relation to the Shared Image Gallery
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the session host name.
This is a switch parameter which let you control the output to show only the sessionhosts which are not started from the latest version.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the session host name.
This is a switch parameter which let you control the output to show only the sessionhosts which are not started from the latest version.
Gets the latest session host from the WVD Hostpool
The function will help you getting the latests session host from a WVD Hostpool. By running this function you will able to define the next number for deploying new session hosts.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
With this switch parameter you will set, you will get the next sessionhost number returned.
You can put the hostpool object in here.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
With this switch parameter you will set, you will get the next sessionhost number returned.
You can put the hostpool object in here.
Gets the sessionhost network information
The function will help you getting insights about the WVD network configuration.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
This parameter accepts a single sessionhost name
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
This parameter accepts a single sessionhost name
Gets the current AVD Session hosts from a specific hostpool.
This function will grab all the sessionhost from a specific Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name
Gets the Virtual Machines Azure resource from a WVD Session Host
The function will help you getting the virtual machine resource information which is behind the WVD Session Host
{{ Fill HostpoolName Description }}
{{ Fill ResourceGroupName Description }}
{{ Fill SessionHostName Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdSessionHostResources -SessionHost SessionHostObject Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Moving sessionhosts from an Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool to a new one.
The function will move sessionhosts to a new Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.
Enter the source AVD Hostpool name
Enter the source Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the destination AVD Hostpool name
Enter the destination Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name avd-hostpool/avd-host-1.avd.domain
Enter the source AVD Hostpool name
Enter the source Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the destination AVD Hostpool name
Enter the destination Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name avd-hostpool/avd-host-1.avd.domain

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Move-AvdSessionhost -FromHostpoolName avd-hostpool -FromResourceGroupName rg-avd-01 -ToHostpoolName avd-hostpool-02 -ToResourceGroupName rg-avd-02 -SessionHostName avd-host-1.avd.domain

maml:description.maml:para: Removing sessionhosts from an Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.

Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name

Enter the sessionhosts name

Removing sessionhosts from an Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.
The function will search for sessionhosts and will remove them from the Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
If needed fill in the custom rdp properties (for example: targetisaadjoined:i:1 )
Change the host pool friendly name
Change the host pool loadBalancerType
Change the host pool validation environment
Change the host pool max session limit (max 999999)
use the force parameter if you want to override the current customrdpproperties. Otherwise it will add the provided properties.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
If needed fill in the custom rdp properties (for example: targetisaadjoined:i:1 )
Change the host pool friendly name
Change the host pool loadBalancerType
Change the host pool validation environment
Change the host pool max session limit (max 999999)
use the force parameter if you want to override the current customrdpproperties. Otherwise it will add the provided properties.
Will create a new registration token which you need to onboard new session hosts
The function will create a new registration token, if needed, and will return the value which you need to onboard new session hosts
Enter the AVD Hostpool name
Enter the AVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Optional, give the token availability in hours. Default 4.
Enter the AVD Hostpool name
Enter the AVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Optional, give the token availability in hours. Default 4.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Update-AvdRegistrationToken -HostpoolName avd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName avd-resourcegroup Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Updates sessionhosts for accepting or denying connections.
The function will update sessionhosts drainmode to true or false. This can be one sessionhost or all of them.
An sessionhost object or array of sessionhosts.
Enter $true or $false.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name
Enter $true or $false.
An sessionhost object or array of sessionhosts.
Enter the WVD Hostpool name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name
Enter $true or $false.
